Description: Fragment of Archaic East Greek 'sofa-rim' pottery plate. Whitish slip on inside and outside, decoration in brown-black glaze. On top of rim, cable-pattern with palmettes in interstices; on floor, and partly overlapping the join with rim, a broken meander band between horizontal bands; then slight step in profile, and remains of vertical strokes, possibly from a metopal pattern; outside of rim and of splaying, rounded, ring foot glazed; broad band of glaze also on part of raised relief band on underside. Light orange-brown clay with some mica, lime and other inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by McLean Museum and Art Gallery, Greenock. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Written in pencil on outside of rim 'Greek'.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG1017)
